definition: stratagem
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
surname Ce

sentences.english: Harry often clea his room as a tactic to avoid doing his homework.
sentences.chinese: 哈里常以打掃房間作爲逃避做作業的計策。

sentences.english: He is very happy to see his stratagem at work.
sentences.chinese: 看到自己的計策正在起作用，他很高興。

sentences.english: Harry often cleans his room as a tactic to avoid doing his homework.
sentences.chinese: 哈里常以打掃房間作爲逃避做作業的計策。

sentences.english: Find out what constants and method declarations belong to an interface.
sentences.chinese: 找出一個接口定義的常量和計策。

sentences.english: The resourceful jurist formed a plan to recover his own laurels .
sentences.chinese: 足智多謀的法學家已經想出了一個恢復名譽的計策。

sentences.english: So Duke Xian of the State of Jin accepted Xun Xi's plan.
sentences.chinese: 晉獻公採納了荀息的計策。

sentences.english: We were interested in which factor determines the rut tactics of individual stags .
sentences.chinese: 我們對何種因素決定麋鹿個體的發情交配計策感興趣。

sentences.english: Small devil see Wallace failed, had to touch the nose back.
sentences.chinese: 小魔鬼看到計策失敗，只好摸摸鼻子回去了。

sentences.english: The Covenant ploy, however, had worked.
sentences.chinese: 可是聖約人的計策成功了。

sentences.english: There are a few strategies you can use to make bad tasting tasks a little more pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 你可以利用一些計策使無聊的事情變得更加有趣一點。

definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
stratagem/scheme
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
hard to distinguish real from imitation
Pang Juan (-342 BC), military leader and political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
